00036 // Connect objects are used as containers for information pertaining to a
00037 // connection that a user program makes to a dataset. The dataset may be
00038 // either local (i.e., a file on the user's own computer) or a remote
00039 // dataset. In the later case a DODS URL will be used to reference the
00040 // dataset. 
00041 //
00042 // Connect contains methods which can be used to read the DOS DAS and DDS
00043 // objects from the remote dataset as well as reading reading data. The class
00044 // understands in a rudimentary way how DODS constraint expressions are
00045 // formed and how to manage the CEs generated by a API to request specific
00046 // variables with the URL initially presented to the class when the object
00047 // was instantiated.
00048 //
00049 // Connect also provides additional services such as error processing.
00050 //
00051 // Connect is not intended for use on the server-side of DODS.
00052 //
00053 // jhrg 9/29/94
00054 
00055 #ifndef _connect_h
00056 #define _connect_h
00057 
00058 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00059 #ifdef __GNUG__
00060 #pragma interface
00061 #endif
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 #include <stdio.h>
00065 
00066 #include <string>
00067 
00068 #ifndef _das_h
00069 #include "DAS.h"
00070 #endif
00071

00073 #include "DDS.h"
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 #ifndef _error_h
00077 #include "Error.h"
00078 #endif
00079 
00080 #ifndef _util_h
00081 #include "util.h"
00082 #endif
00083 
00084 #ifndef _datadds_h
00085 #include "DataDDS.h"
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 #ifndef _httpconnect_h
00089 #include "HTTPConnect.h"
00090 #endif
00091 
00092 #ifndef response_h
00093 #include "Response.h"
00094 #endif
00095 
00096 using std::string;
00097 
00133 class Connect {
00134 private:
00135     bool _local;        // Is this a local connection?
00136 
00137     HTTPConnect *d_http;
00138 
00139     // *** These are used by deprecated methods only!
00140     DAS _das;           // Dataset attribute structure
00141     DDS _dds;           // Dataset descriptor structure
00142     Error _error;       // Error object
00143 
00144     string _URL;        // URL to remote dataset (minus CE)
00145     string _proj;       // Projection part of initial CE.
00146     string _sel;        // Selection of initial CE
00147 
00148     string d_version;
00149 
00150     void process_data(DataDDS &data, Response *rs) 
00151     throw(Error, InternalErr);
00152     
00153     // Use when you cannot use libwww/libcurl. Reads HTTP response. 
00154     void parse_mime(FILE *data_source, Response *rs);
00155 
00156 protected:
00159     Connect() { }
00160     Connect(const Connect &rhs) { }
00161     Connect &operator=(const Connect &rhs) {
00162     throw InternalErr(__FILE__, __LINE__, "Unimplemented assignment");
00163     }
00165 
00166 public:
00167     // This ctor is deprecated. See Connect.cc 
00168     Connect(const string &name, bool www_verbose_errors,
00169         bool accept_deflate, string uname = "",
00170         string password = "") throw (Error, InternalErr); 
00171 
00172     Connect(const string &name, string uname = "", string password = "") 
00173     throw (Error, InternalErr); 
00174 
00175     virtual ~Connect();
00176 
00177     bool is_local();
00178 
00179     // *** Add get_* versions of accessors. 02/27/03 jhrg
00180     virtual string URL(bool CE = true);
00181     virtual string CE();
00182     
00183     void set_credentials(string u, string p);
00184     void set_accept_deflate(bool deflate);
00185 
00186     void set_cache_enabled(bool enabled);
00187     bool is_cache_enabled();
00188 
00195     string get_version() { return d_version; }
00196 
00197     virtual string request_version() throw(Error, InternalErr);
00198 
00199     virtual void request_das(DAS &das) throw(Error, InternalErr);
00200 
00201     virtual void request_dds(DDS &dds, string expr = "") 
00202     throw(Error, InternalErr);
00203 
00204     virtual void request_data(DataDDS &data, string expr = "") 
00205     throw(Error, InternalErr);
00206 
00207     // *** The Response breaks this, replace with a FileConnect
00208     virtual void read_data(DataDDS &data, FILE *data_source) 
00209     throw(Error, InternalErr);
00210 
00211     bool request_dds(bool gui = false, const string &ext = "dds")
00212     throw(Error, InternalErr) {
00213     request_dds(_dds, "");
00214 
00215     return true;
00216     }
00217 
00218     DDS *request_data(string expr, bool gui = false, bool async = false, 
00219               const string &ext = "dods") throw(Error, InternalErr) {
00220     DataDDS *new_dds = new DataDDS("received_data");
00221     request_data(*new_dds, expr);
00222     return new_dds;
00223     }
00224 
00225     bool request_das(bool gui = false,  const string &ext = "das")
00226     throw(Error, InternalErr) {
00227     request_das(_das);
00228     return true;
00229     }
00230 
00233     void *gui() {
00234     return 0;
00235     }
00236 
00237     DDS *read_data(FILE *data_source, bool gui, bool async)
00238     throw(Error, InternalErr) {
00239     DataDDS *data = new DataDDS;
00240     read_data(*data, data_source);
00241     return data;
00242     }
00243 
00244     // These are deprecated.
00245     DAS &das();
00246     DDS &dds();
00247     Error &error();
00248 };

00267  * in the .dodsrc file. This was left over behavior from before we started
00268  * using that file. However, now HTTPConnect (and later other protocol
00269  * modules?) look at the value in the .dodsrc (using RCReader) and decide
00270  * what action to take.

00323  * tops of files while looking for globals, et c., and I fixed them up
00324  * (hopefully making them easier to read, ...). Only the files RCReader.cc
00325  * and usage.cc actually use pthreads synchronization functions. In other
00326  * cases I removed static objects where they were used for supposed

00328  * which looked dubious).

00330  * Revision 1.49.4.15  2002/07/06 19:36:32  jimg
00331  * Added throw(...) specification to Connect's ctor.
00332  *
00333  * Revision 1.49.4.14  2002/06/21 22:23:07  jimg
00334  * I revised the basic interface to this class. The old interface is implemented
00335  * using the new one. Methods to get objects from DODS objects now take
00336  * references to the containers for those objects as formal parameters. This
00337  * enables a user of Connect to control how/when/where those containers are
00338  * created and managed.
00339  *
00340  * Revision 1.49.4.13  2002/06/20 23:59:37  jimg
00341  * I added a new method to access the DDS. This represents the first
00342  * substantive change to Connect's interface in a long time. The new method
00343  * is request_dds(DDS &dds, string expr, const string &ext = "dds"). Use this
00344  * method to have Connect read a DDS for you into an instance of DDS your
00345  * code has allocated/created. This makes Connect much more flexible since
00346  * your program (e.g., a subclass of Connect) can have many DDS objects, not
00347  * just the one that Connect holds internally, without duplicating the code
00348  * that reads URLs (which would have become a major problem when we start
00349  * supporting access by other protocols). This is far from complete, but just
00350  * this one method makes it possible to rewrite nce-dods/NCConnect so that
00351  * it'll work with the new Connect that uses libcurl (through an instance of
00352  * HTTPConnect).
00353  *
00354  * Revision 1.49.4.12  2002/06/20 06:22:13  jimg

00356  * as before.

00397  * Revision 1.49.4.5  2001/07/28 01:10:41  jimg
00398  * Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00399  * I added those where they were needed.
00400  * In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00401  * just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00402  * before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00403  * just good form when using delete.
00404  * I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00405  * making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00406  * set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00407  * comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00408  * characters on their own.

00416  * Revision 1.49.4.3  2001/04/16 17:10:00  jimg
00417  * Added a companion field void *_gui for the field Gui *_gui. The former is
00418  * used when `GUI' is not defined. This makes sure (assuming that the size of
00419  * the two pointers is identical) that code which uses libdap++-gui.a gets the
00420  * correct definition of Connect if it does not define GUI itself. Note that the
00421  * whole `defining GUI' thing is a hack which should go away during some future
00422  * refactoring of Connect so I'd rather patch around the problem like this than
00423  * say every client must define GUI or create two include files.

00440  * modified to do its job.
00441  * Added process_www_errors() to streamline error reporting for both the popup
00442  * and non-popup version of this class. This friend function is called directly
00443  * from Connect's methods, not via a libwww callback. This was necessary because
00444  * it throws Error objects and throws don't (seem to, anyway) work from within
00445  * callbacks.

00612  * Removed GUI code to a new class - Gui.
00613  *
00614  * Revision 1.16  1996/06/18 23:41:01  jimg
00615  * Added support for a GUI. The GUI is actually contained in a separate program
00616  * that is run in a subprocess. The core `talks' to the GUI using a pty and a
00617  * simple command language.
00618  *
00619  * Revision 1.15  1996/06/08 00:07:57  jimg
00620  * Added support for compression. The Content-Encoding header is used to
00621  * determine if the incoming document is compressed (values: x-plain; no
00622  * compression, x-gzip; gzip compression). The gzip program is used to
00623  * decompress the document. The new software uses UNIX IPC and a separate
00624  * subprocess to perform the decompression.
00625  *
00626  * Revision 1.14  1996/06/04 21:33:17  jimg
00627  * Multiple connections are now possible. It is now possible to open several
00628  * URLs at the same time and read from them in a round-robin fashion. To do
00629  * this I added data source and sink parameters to the serialize and
00630  * deserialize mfuncs. Connect was also modified so that it manages the data
00631  * source `object' (which is just an XDR pointer).
00632  *
00633  * Revision 1.13  1996/05/29 21:51:51  jimg
00634  * Added the enum ObjectType. This is used when a Content-Description header is
00635  * found by the WWW library to record the type of the object without first
00636  * parsing it.
00637  * Added ctors for the struct constraint.
00638  * Removed the member _request.
00639  *
00640  * Revision 1.12  1996/05/21 23:46:33  jimg
00641  * Added support for URLs directly to the class. This uses version 4.0D of
00642  * the WWW library from W3C.

00655  * The mfuncs request_{das,dds,dods} accept a parameter which is appended to
00656  * the URL and used by the data server CGI to select which filter program is
00657  * run to handle a particular request. I changed the parameter name from cgi
00658  * to ext to better represent what was going on (after getting confused
00659  * several times myself).

00672  * Revision 1.5  1995/03/09  20:36:09  jimg
00673  * Modified so that URLs built by this library no longer supply the
00674  * base name of the CGI. Instead the base name is stripped off the front
00675  * of the pathname component of the URL supplied by the user. This class
00676  * append the suffix _das, _dds or _serv when a Connect object is used to
00677  * get the DAS, DDS or Data (resp).
